column5: LOL I will use "accuwindow"  that's were you look out the window to get the weather report  never been wrong  well there was that weekend when I was young and the wrong kind of mushrooms but that's a different story
LOL...I'll never forget WKRP in Cincinatti...  They had the "I-Witness" weather....where he goes to the window (like you Terry) and witnesses the weather.....

Yes and it will prbly change yet again too ????>>>>  well i hope everyone should already know when you are fishing the Bay Of Quinte at this time of year you have to expect any & every kind of weather especially down there !!!!!like they say prepare for the worst,even on sunday for example,kevin & myself had at least 3 kinds of weather in one day it started real sunny & cold ,then got warm,then the wind got up,and dam it got cold again,...so you have to ready for everything,just make sure you have more clothes than what you need,specially if you get wet & bring warm boots & shoes,cause they might get wet as well....man i have been doing this for alot of years and see people underdressed all the time,they are the ones whos trip will be cut short,cause they wernt prepared !!!!!so im redy to face the elements and i hope everyone else is as well....thanks for the weather update....cheers  BAY OF QUINTE HERE WE COME !!!!!!!
Hopefully its not like the first weekend we were out with gusts over 70km.  Either way we will be out there!
yeah but you start to hyperventilate in 2 footers

http://www.accuweather.com/canada-forecast...ric=1&set=1 Dress warm, be prepared for 2-3 footers on Saturday and those of us fishin Friday... she's gonna be a kidney knocker! Also, those heading down on Thursday... take'er easy, take your time and arrive well! HH Sunday looks like a fair weather fishermans day!

Wow...amazing how different the forecasts can be....here's The Weather Networks.... http://www.theweathernetwork.com/weather/caon0540/  Environment Canada http://www.weatheroffice.gc.ca/city/pages/on-3_metric_e.html  Sailflow.com is saying about 15 knots from Thursday til Saturday. (Sandbanks)  Windguru is alsto saying 15 knots (Sandbanks)
Yup, windguru says 15 knots or 28kph gusting to 61kph.
funny how another weather net work has a different forecast.Not as windy  Visit My Website  not my website but another link  Can someone tell me how to add  in a link properly  MTP
Well, let's hope it helps to thin out the crowd a bit! HH
I am so happy to have purchased an 18ft boat
dammnnnn.. its going to be a windy one.. i hope my crestliner can handle it.. if not, i might have to bail after all this work!
Good thing I'm leavin the 14ft tinny at home....LOL

There are places you can fish where you can generally get out of the bad stuff... that being said, better to be safe, then sorry. Bring extra gloves, hats, socks... what ever you need to keep warm. Also, at the end of the day, don't forget to turn your float suite inside out and allow it to dry over night or you'll be getting into a cold damp suit the next morning! Also remove the liners from your boats and allow them to dry out over night. HH
wel,l we know weather men can't tell what it's going to do in 3 hours, so long range means nothing..see you on the water
At least the brown pop will be cold  Great thing about BOQ is there always a place to fish.  Like Terry, said it will change..
actually yup.. always a place to fish.. many areas that are sheltered.. see you all there !
If I Had a dime for every time the weather man was right. I'd be broke and hungry.
Monday looks splendid ! LOL  Besides Joe..that's what the top is for! Engines idling in REVERSE...top up..1.5  MPH.. we're good !

Well that what you got to expect this time of year down there at quinte,its been rough there last weekend to we were in big waves on saturday big time...but thats walleye fishin weather!!!!! bring it on !!!!!
Good thing I am going to have a couple of great navigators!  G.
You guys are scaring me....  But I can't wait...
You dont mean me do you?  Who else is in the boat with us???
You'll be fine in that new ride of yours Shelley !
He didn't tell you about his imaginary friend
Purchasing all those carbon credits is paying off.
Y'all make sure my Dawg wears his life jacket up there and be safe!!! Joe
Surprise surprise... it changed again! http://www.accuweather.com/canada-forecast...ric=1&set=1 HH

Thanks HH....just rechecked sailflow.com and they are now saying 10 knot winds on Saturday and Sunday(down from 15) and the same for Windguru.  They both say Saturday night winds going up to 16 knots, then die off to 10 by morning again.  Environment Canada's website and The Weathernetwork do not show any snow/ice in their forecasts though....  The weather will be what it will be....watch...it'll be calm winds, 20C....LOL.
